candidate_text: The infamous "Feed me a stray cat" line from American Psycho!

In the 2000 film adaptation of Bret Easton Ellis' novel "American Psycho," there's a pivotal and somewhat enigmatic scene in which Patrick Bateman, the protagonist, asks his fiancée Evelyn to "Feed me a stray cat."
A rather infamous and disturbing scene from the 2000 film American Psycho, directed by Mary Harron.
The scene you're referring to shows Patrick Bateman (played by Christian Bale) feeding a stray cat to a large dog at his fiancée's apartment building.

While this scene might seem gratuitously violent or senseless at first glance, it actually serves several purposes within the narrative:

Patrick feeds the cat to the dog without anyone noticing or intervening, reflecting how easily harm can be perpetrated when people turn a blind eye or fail to intervene.
No one intervenes or reports Patrick's actions, reflecting how easily we turn a blind eye to violence and suffering, especially when committed by someone perceived as respectable or influential.

The people in the surrounding apartments, oblivious to the gruesome act occurring mere feet away, reflect the lack of empathy and awareness that allows individuals like Patrick to hide in plain sight.
